content.description:
Stem the left facing corner that leads up to a thin crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolt, great holds above the crux for a solid finish.


Left facing crack on dark rock. 
5 bolts - bolt anchor. Top accessible for set up or walk off. Can use the Rap Rings from the next route over to rap down if desired.

climbs.name: Lichen in my Cleavage
climbs.fa: Devin Rigg, 24 May 2014. Setter Philip Stone

content.description:
Lots of ledges and great resting spots on this left trending climb. Follows the disjointed crack most of the way up. Leave the crack near the top for a thin finish.

Look for the cave at the right (East) end of the cave, Lichen in my Cleavage is the climb just on the left edge of this cave.
5 bolts + upper top tope anchor + rappel ring anchor

climbs.name: Saddle Route
climbs.fa: Devon Rigg, 24 May 2015 - Setter: Philip Stone

content.description:
A powerful bouldery sequence leads up to a roof with great holds. Rest above the roof before tackling the thin section while trending left to finish.

Recommend using a longer draw on the 3rd bolt (under the roof). If you are going to work this climb on top tope, recommend using a rope bag or something on the top near the anchor as the high friction rock will eat your rope for breakfast (+ add extra rope drag).

Just to the right of Thighmaster (the large massive obvious roof)
6 bolts - bolt anchor

climbs.name: Sock Hop
climbs.fa: Renée Stone, Nic Manders, Philip Stone 21 February 2018

content.description:
Angle up and left, stepping across the large crack from the cave. Continue along upper ridge, left to top.

Begins to the right of the large cave at the right end of the crag.
8 bolts (incl. 1 anchor bolt of anchor station en route)) + rap rings

climbs.name: Thighmaster
climbs.fa: Alexandra le Trionneire, Alexis Crellin, 28 May 2015. Setter: Phillip Stone

content.description:
Start up the short corner trending right at the edge of the huge angled roof. Turn the arete over an obvious square block that sticks out from the rock, reach up over the roof to the dark rock where a jug helps you pull through the roof. It is also a great rest spot before sending the thin section with a smooth v slot. Great holds at the very top.

If you are going to work this via top rope be sure to have a rope bag or something to place on the rope edge near the anchor as this rock is super high friction and will eat your rope for breakfast. A long anchor system may not be long enough...

The large overhanging roof with an obvious rectangular black jetting out from the rock
7 bolts - bolt anchor

Climb thin holds up the face following the bolts to the left, pull the notch at the roof's lip and easier climbing to the anchor.

The face below and to the left of the very large, imposing roof.
5 bolts + rap rings

Very fun easy route. A great beginner leader route, but short. An odd move to get up into the corner leads to great holds and fun stemming.

Far left edge of the belay ledge.
5 bolts + rap rings

Beautiful south facing sunny crag with plenty of trees for shade in the heat. Fantastic views of the ocean & the island forests. Great place to hang out all day! 
 Plenty of climbs for all levels from 5.7 - 5.12+ with a super fun VO boulder traverse up top above the climbs.  
 Most of the climbs are top rope-able, recommend bringing long anchor material and/or a rope bag to place on the rock rub spots near the anchor - the crag as amazingly high friction rock, which is great for your feet but but isn't so rope friendly sometimes :)
